argumentText:
ARGUMENT

| Step | Hyp | Ref | Expression |
|---|---|---|---|

| 1 |  | sbrbif.1 | |- ( ch -> A. x ch ) |
| 2 |  | sbrbif.2 | |- ( [ y / x ] ph <-> ps ) |
| 3 | 2 | #P_sbrbis | |- ( [ y / x ] ( ph <-> ch ) <-> ( ps <-> [ y / x ] ch ) ) |
| 4 | 1 | #P_sbh | |- ( [ y / x ] ch <-> ch ) |
| 5 | 4 | #P_bibi2i | |- ( ( ps <-> [ y / x ] ch ) <-> ( ps <-> ch ) ) |
| 6 | 3, 5 | #P_bitri | |- ( [ y / x ] ( ph <-> ch ) <-> ( ps <-> ch ) ) |
\
 Introduce right biconditional inside of a substitution.  (Contributed by NM, 18-Aug-1993.)
